definition: to sharpen on grindstone/to improve oneself by practice
to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist

sentences.english: Bao Jianfeng from sharpening out, plum blossom from the bitter cold.
sentences.chinese: 寶劍鋒從磨礪出，梅花噴鼻自苦寒來。

sentences.english: Hard working conditions buld up character.
sentences.chinese: 艱苦的工作條件能磨礪人的性格。

sentences.english: I think it whets our appetite for the next things to come.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得我們的胃口接下來磨礪的東西。

sentences.english: But it may be a long and painful grind.
sentences.chinese: 但是，這將會是一個漫長而痛苦的磨礪過程。

sentences.english: My powers of observation were honed through it.
sentences.chinese: 我的觀察力也得到磨礪。

sentences.english: She found, however, that it was one to which she must inure herself.
sentences.chinese: 不過她覺得，她必須使自己習慣於這磨礪。

sentences.english: In the reality of the furnace, the heart will be coarseness and inhospitality gradually.
sentences.chinese: 在現實的磨礪中，心卻漸漸的粗糙冷漠。

sentences.english: One successful hunt is enough to sharpen their inborn skills.
sentences.chinese: 一次成功的狩獵足夠磨礪它們天生的技能。

sentences.english: This machine is used for grinding flat clothing for textile trade.
sentences.chinese: 該機主要用於紡織企業對蓋板針布的磨礪。

sentences.english: Because the Sun and moon honed, rock Daisy seems slightly different, gorgeous.
sentences.chinese: 由於日月的磨礪，石菊花便顯得形態各異，絢麗多姿。

sentences.english: Fragrance of plum blossom is sweet in bitter cold.
sentences.chinese: 寶劍鋒自磨礪出，梅花香自苦寒來。

sentences.english: Twenty years of grounding, make sure we don't recognize each other.
sentences.chinese: 二十年光陰的磨礪，肯定會讓我們都認不出彼此了。

sentences.english: They have pushed themselves to be as sharp as a razor's edge.
sentences.chinese: 他們已經把自己磨礪得像刀尖一樣鋒利。

sentences.english: All the better. It will be honed by the sandstorms of the northern deserts.
sentences.chinese: 正好，塞外的風沙能磨礪出他的堅強。
他有了一個充滿磨礪的短途旅行。

sentences.english: I convergence in my hands and feet, to protect, but difficult to avoid grounding.
sentences.chinese: 我收斂我的手腳，極力袒護，但還是要難避磨礪。
